1.content:
It was the start of a normal day for John, he’d got up, yelled at his room mate for not bring in the post. Called his girl friend, and went off to work. He hated his job, but he needed the cash. He worked at a fast food place, he thought it was so degrading. When he got there he did his best, but to the boss that wasn’t good enough, he kept yelling at him, even if he did nothing wrong.

After working till his shift was over he went back to his house, “Yo… Ash… I’m home…” he yelled coming in.
“Hey, Something came for you… a package… it’s in your room…” A'shter said coming into the room, John and A'shter where good friends, even though many people didn’t think a lion anthro and Naga could get along, they did.
“Thanks…” John said going up the stairs…

And there on his bed like A'shter had said, was a package. John looked at it and went up to it and opened it looking at what was inside. There was a weird looking gun, with grow and shrink on it. There were also some other buttons, but John just looked back in the box it came in to see a card, on it is said ‘From Shub’

“Shub?” John thought, “Who the hell is Shub?” then he remembered some old wife’s tail about the most powerful and first God of our Galaxy or something was called Shub. John shrugged it of and looked back at the gun… “I wonder if it works…”

11122112211221.content:
The three seconds where John looked like a wolf passed quickly, it was just a coincidence really. When it had fully passed and finished, he looked down at black feet, black hands a slightly white belly and orange everywhere else besides his black ear tips. Another look around showed he'd also lost some height, to now stand at 8 ft tall rather than the 10 he was earlier.

Rachel too, was a fox. The difference of their species had always been a problem, but not now! The question was, would she even recognize him? There really seemed only one way to find out, go see her. She wouldn't believe a random fox to be her boyfriend though, so he'd grow more and go over as the giant, random fox.

Without another though, John turned to Ash and blasted him back to normal size, saying, "we can have fun later, I gotta run." And run was the truth, Rachel lived way off and away, he'd have to run even as a giant. With the ray aimed at him, the no-longer-lion-now-fox blasted himself skyward to easily stand above the trees at 315 feet tall, leaving the trees perhaps a foot long and therfore not even as big as his tail.

Down below, Ash ran to the house as the fox's feet expanded to in the end shoot over him 15 ft tall, the pads under them left huge holes in the ground. He grumbled about the wrecked yard and how he'd be fixing it without ever having any fun from it. The drops now going from 3 to 5 feet deep.

A second later, John was gone, covering miles in seconds rather than the two or three minutes of a track runner. The neighborhood and surrounding area was just a toy-land to him. Luckily for most of the people, he was sticking to roads rather than backyards and anyone with any brains driving on the road would see the 15 foot tall toes and get out of their way. LIke that, the roads were shredded across the area by a gigantic fox.
11122112211221.title: Foxy

111221122112211.content:
After a few more minutes, John reaches Rachel's house. He slowed his approach and did what he could to avoid making noise so as to surprise her. At her front door he extending a claw and 'tapped' the inch tall door. He stepped back and after a few seconds, the door opened.

Rachel opened the door and stepped out, right in her yard were two black walls, she followed them up into towers and then an enormous fox. She was going to scream, but before she got that far, the toes smothered her against the ground. She couldn't move, but clearly it wasn't even the weight of a toe.

"Rachel, ssshh!" John says and then hears the police coming, he develops a sense of urgency. "Its me, John! I've got something amazing to show you! I'll let you go, just don't scream."

The enormous fox takes his foot away and leaves a quick few steps going down the road before blasting himself to normal and running up. He quickly gets her in the house and says, "I can change soo much stuff, but listen, there's police coming, I need to hide. They'll think any fox with colors like mine is the 'giant' and they're probably gonna search here."

"This is amazing" Rachel says at first, then goes about fixing the problem, "can you get any smaller? You could hide in my fur."

"You'll have the smallest boyfriend in the world, but that works" John said and then once more blasted himself, glad for the hardwood floors in this part of the house. He went from being a whole head taller than the girl to an inch tall. There she interupted and pinned him as he had her, coating him in a layer of sweat.

"Just a piece of payback" the giantess said before releasing him. He white hand comes down and picks up her tiny boyfriend to drop him on her shoulder amidst a field of fur.

In a good perch, John blasts himself again, even an inch tall he'd stood out on the shoulder, but now he was far, far, far smaller than a flea. The drop down from here was miles as now even the fox's fur was 1000 feet tall, it'd take a very good microscope or magnifying glass to find him now.
111221122112211.title: Rachel

1112211221122112.content:
Almost no time after hiding, there indeed came a knock at the door and a few police officers were here to do a quick search for some mad-scientist or any clue as to why the tracks stop here. There was enough probable cause that a warrant wasn't needed and had it been, they'd recieve it in minutes.

Sitting there, John quickly became bored and he could see little of the world beyond to give him any sort of entertainment. In the end he decided he had to see it and to do that he'd actually have to get smaller. In front of him fur ran forward over Rachel's front like bridges going nowhere. One was sitting under the fox's foot and every few seconds slipped between a toe, it was a rope right now. It'd hold his weight easily but holding on for dear life was not an appealing idea.

With the gun out again, the fox gave himself another shot and ultimately was so small that even a 64'th of an inch was enormous to him. The strand of fur in front of him however, was more than wide enough now to walk on, at least as big as a six lane highway, three going one way, three the other. He had no other way to measure by but what he'd been before, which left him to guess he was a 16th to a 64th of an inch to what he was, which meant in the worst case, Rachel had a boyfriend 1/4100 as tall as her fur.

John walked out onto what he could now only call an enormous bridge. The farther out he went it just got windier and windier and the girl wasn't even moving. He quickly was hugging the ground to avoid a flight off, but that too failed quickly. Over the edge went the fox past at least a few hundred miles of girlfriend, he survived and somehow landed at the very bottom, on her right foot.

After a few seconds, the fox realized where he was. He had thirty or forty miles of walking to do just to get near the end of the foot and then climb up to the ankle and legs. Looking down between splayed toes, all he saw as a dark abyss. Meanwhile from overhead he heard the clanging and booms of the search. The shortest officer, a smaller desert creature of some kind was only 2 feet tall and the closest to anyone's toes, but this small, John could walk all over him and never be found.

In the past, the micro-fox had teased his girlfriend about having little feet, little no longer a toe dwarfed a city by all forms of measurement. Earlier there'd also been payback for him stepping on her, this and her attack earlier more than made up for that...
1112211221122112.title: Rachel, what big feet you have

Unfortunately for the micro fox, Rachel think's he's up top. He turns to look for an edge to jump off and sees five pads from her other foot coming in to scratch this one. They're of course, huge, at least 2 miles long each and the center one, that was just beyond scaling right now.

Quickly John ran, as fast as his tiny fox body would carry him. He reached a gap between the toes, leapt and fell into the abyss, but was blasting himself skyward the whole time. As he grew his momentum picked up and shot him free, he landed on his feet long before he should've hit the ground at that small size and continued to expand from what had been a half inch tall. Soon he's standing at his normal height over his girlfriend.

"What were you doing down there?" Rachel asks after having spotted where the growth came from.

"You shouldn't move so much, I fell off here" John replied, pointing to the point on her shoulder where he had been, "wound up down there and having to be a lot smaller to avoid dieing and nearly got drowned under your sweaty pads. Big foot."

111221122112212.content:
After a few minutes of running, the fox has gotten law enforcement on him. Police cars are following him and going as fast as they can, running around his footprints and trying to catch him. To him, the cars aren't even an inch tall, they cannot keep up but they'd find Rachel when he stops there.

Fighting was not a good idea and so far no one had seen his face anyway, which would make ID'ing him all the harder. Still, John had to get away from them and more speed wasn't all of the solution. Thinking of what all may be done to him, he put on a burst of speed going into an all out sprint, which put some distance between him and the police, in fact quite a few miles. At the sixty miles or so an hour that the cars went, he had about three minutes to disappear.

His tracks ran a few miles down the road farther, he backtracked and quickly fired the ray, shrinking himself. Around him everything grew outwards, soon he was climbing out of his own footprint. The flashing lights and sirens were closing in, he leapt up and ran to a near-by lot/playground, in front of him there was a huge tree surrounded by all the grey dirt of the parking area, open to the street.

Almost flying, the fox shot up the tree and standing with one foot in front of the other for balance, blasted himself again. Seconds later he was sitting in a groove from the bark fox feet dangling over the side. He was now so small that little toy cars wouldn't see him as a road-way threat, but rather dwarfed him by far, as did even fleas. Hard to belive those were his footprints in the roadway.

A minute or two later when the police cars came, John had to cover his ears, the tiny structures and skyscraper tall siren box's were built for two different levels of sound. After a few seconds, the cars were gone and he uncovered his ears, now wondering what to do...

John walked along the branches, climbing on them like mountains as that was the scale of things. A few times he wandered out onto a leaf and it didn't move the slightest under his weight, which in the real world was the near non-existent five-thousandths of a pound compared to his former 180 to perhaps 240 or 280 as a lion. Instinctively the fox yelled up, "Hey, watch it bub." Though as his head moved up he saw the scale of what he was up against if a fight broke out or if he was even heard. A wolf cub, maybe 10 years old and elsewhere in the tree, his friends. His titanic toes were splayed around the branch, his feet too big to just stick on top, same as the fox when he first climbed the tree.

Dan and his friends had gotten together just to goof off and play as kids do. They were prompted out of their houses by a giant creature, maybe a fox they'd all seen running across the area. Among other things the group thought it was cool and perhaps in their playing would pretend they were giants. Though they were far from it... Panicked and in fear of being crushed, John takes aim and blasts the toes in front of him. At first nothing happens, but then at an exponential rate, the cub gets smaller. Soon he's standing in a crack in the bark up to his waist, where earlier he couldn't fit two toes next to each other.

At this point, Dan spots the ray and closes in. Full-sized he hadn't been able to see a beam of light so small, but now he did and quite clearly. It came from a little speck in a groove of the bark a bit to his left. He jumped up and swung himself over the walls around him, just making it to the one with the little speck before he was getting too small to make it.

John looks up and the wolf's closing in, filling the valley of bark with his 700 foot tall mass of destruction. He's miles away but closing fast. Still however, the fox held on the trigger, figuring to be dead either way...

1112211221122121111.content:
The cub closed the distance in no time and just wasn't shrinking fast enough. His enormous paw soon loomed overhead, intent to save his size by crushing the bug that shrank him. The sun was eclipsed behind a 500 foot long tower in the sky, it seemed this was the end.

Thinking fast however, John saved himself. Small objects needed almost completely smooth surfaces to be crushed, else like sand they found a gap to survive in. He quickly turned the ray on himself and was a speck beyond site once again. When the huge foot came down, he was caught in a bit of mud and quickly began to scale the massive beast.

The wolf had just crushed whatever shrank him, though now was not even a half inch tall. He turned and headed towards his friends, they'd help him. As he went the walls around him moved and he was forced to scale some to jump into others, ultimately ending up on the top of the branch. He really hated this...

A 64th of an inch tall to the wolf, John lived on. A few times the titan had thrown him off, but that was in climbing the bark. It ultimately got him off the muddy feet and onto the exposed back and its forest of fur. There he kept going and climbed towards the shoulders and hopefully safety where he wouldn't be found until he could save himself...

1112211221122121112.content:
John kept firing. The ray was shrinking the cub faster now, but would it be enough? The wolf was still 200 feet tall and only 300 feet away. The branch quivered slightly as the giant continued running for John. As it got within 50 feet, John squeezed his eyes shut, waiting for death he knew was coming.

It never came. The vibrations stopped and John slowly opened his eyes. He let off the trigger and breathed a sigh of relief. He was alive, and the wolf cub was nowhere in sight. Quickly, another thought entered his mind. Where was the cub? Getting down on his hands and knees, he began to look.

Dan rushed madly at the beam. However, the more he ran, the larger the beam and bark around him grew. By the time he reached the source of the beam, he saw it was an older fox holding a gun (the actual source of the beam) and tightly shutting his eyes. This might have been the giant fox from earlier. In fact, Dan believed it was! But there was a problem; he was 10 feet away from the fox and was now only half its height. He tried yelling at the fox, but the beam must have prevented him because Dan couldn't speak. He couldn't escape the beam either because it was now wider than a house. The smaller Dan became, the faster he shrank. Finally, he sat down in defeat and waited for it to stop. The beam shut off seconds later and Dan could see again. Seeing the fox from this perspective, Dan knew it was the one he'd seen earlier. Quickly, he put two and two together, realizing that it was the gun the fox was holding that was the cause of all this. The fox had now opened his eyes and breathed a big sigh of relief. The calm didn't last long. The fox muttered something to itself and got down on its hands and knees, presumably looking for the puny wolf. It was shocking to the little wolf to see something so large. The fox's enormous hand landed just a few feet from Dan. Staring at the trash truck sized claw on the middle finger was bad enough, but seeing the actual size of the finger and the hand beyond it were mindboggling. How was he going to survive this?

John couldn't even think. This was completely outside the realm of reality. It had to be.

And yet, there was A'shter's face, on an anthro dragon body comparable to a deity, with a massive raygun in one hand and a smug expression on his face as he peered down at him. If he wasn't moving slightly and the pecs on his chest weren't stretching and contracting every time he breathed, he would've almost believed it was some massive statue dedicated in his friend's image.

But it wasn't. His friend had turned into a living mountain of muscle and scales. John's mind reeled, just absorbing that the person he was lording it over as he was down by his chest moments ago was now so big he could smother him with a single step- and he was ten feet tall!

"JOHN!"

The behemoth's voice snapped John out of his trance as he held his ears reflexively from the loud noise.

"Just who I was looking for. Can you hold still for a second?"

John watched as A'shter bent over, blocking out the sun with his massive frame, and knew what was about to happen. He stumbled backward, considering running for it, he tripped- Ash's massive hand had been laid behind him and he'd fallen into the palm. He wasn't even as tall as it was wide, he noticed, as he was raised past the legs taller than the houses around them, the humblingly large dick which poked out of his slit, and the abs which looked like something chiseled into the side of a cliff. His hand-platform stopped at Ash's pecs, each bigger than moon-bounces. John looked up, defeated.

"So... you used the gun," He said weakly.

"A LOT MORE THAN YOU, APPARENTLY," Ash laughed, booming back down to his tiny pal. John winced- the closer distance apparently magnified his voice that much more.

"You're HUGE!"

"NO, MAN, YOU'RE TINY. I MEAN, NOT-EVEN-THREE-INCHES-TALL, TINY." John looked around him, surrounded by Ash's fingers. The pinky was about his size, if you didn't include the claw at the end. "That's... pretty cool."

"OH, YEAH." Just then, a massive push came up from beneath John. Before he realized it, he was in the air. John yelled as his limbs flailed, looking for solid ground. Just as soon as it started, John hit the smoothed solid ground again, gravity returning to normal.

He had just been tossed.

"Don't DO that!" John yelled as Ash chuckled deeply and throatily, and that's when he realized- this godlike titan had total control over him. The very ground he stood on, the very terrain around him, the fingers on which he was now leaning for support, WERE Ash. The smallest of his movements had completely jumbled his very perceptions of up and down. The only thing that kept him from plunging hundreds of feet below was Ash, who probably was too busy enjoying himself to realize such.

John was hardly a small or weak anthro compared with others, due to his own short experience with the gun, but he had to sit down at this realization.

"Look, can you set me down now? I don't like being up this high!"

"IN A SECOND, DUDE." John's stomach dropped a little bit more at hearing this. "I JUST WANT TO TEST SOMETHING OUT. I THINK I KNOW WHAT MOST OF THESE BUTTONS DO, BUT I DON'T KNOW ABOUT THIS ONE. HOLD STILL, WOULD YOU?"

"Ash, NO! I'm not your guinea pi-" John didn't even get to finish his sentence as he was blasted with the "?" function of the gun next to him. He squinted at the bright light, then felt a shaking sensation in his head, between his ears. "What the..." he started, and then trailed off as a set of somewhat short gazelle antlers shot out. As he felt around on the top of his head, studying by touch his new appendages, Ash smiled.

"OH, TOO COOL! IT'S A RANDOM FUNCTION!" John cried out again, "STOP THIS!" But to no avail- Ash fired again. This time the trembling happened behind him, and John suddenly felt a great deal more length to his shoulder-blade's movements. He'd sprouted a set of large swan wings, luckily not replacing his arms. They actually matched his horns and mane surprisingly well, though he had no way of knowing. He took the wings in instantly, his attention still focused on Ash, who was laughing and charging up looking full well like he was about to go for a third blast.

John didn't wait. "I SAID STOP!" He ran off the edge of the palm and jumped, just as the blast went off. "WHA- HEY!" Ash yelled, as the blast went through where John had been seconds ago and hit his hand. John fell for only a moment- his wings felt amazingly natural, and picked him up instantly. He heard a massive crackling, shifting sound behind him, but he didn't turn to look- he was flapping his wings as much as he could, trying to get away from the abundance of dragon behind him.

He didn't make it far. A massive structure appeared in front of him, and he crashed into it before he could react.
----
He groaned as he woke up in his own warm wings, recognizing Ash by the smooth scale of his palm before he could identify the fingers towering around him. A figure prodded his back more forcefully than he would have liked, as another one... stroked his mane? And a third poked his gut? What was going on?

He rolled over, prepared to look up at Ash... and his jaw dropped.

The "?" function had apparently given him a new set of limbs, as two new arm-like appendages completely identical to his original sprouted out at his sides. John was sitting on the palm of the one on A'shter's lower right. Ash himself was now sitting down in the remains of John's house.

"OH, COOL, YOU'RE AWAKE!" He boomed out, again causing John to wince. Two massive hands approached from either side, pinched his arms, and pulled John to a standing position.

1233.title: Skaters

12331.content:
Two birds actually could be killed with one stone. With careful aim, John nailed the whole group of younger siblings in one shot. Quickly, they grew skyward until for every inch they saw, their siblings would see 10 feet. They towered over the crowds now and filled the boardwalk, one saw their heads ending around the four and five hundred foot mark.

After a few seconds, the cubs realized what had happened and first off spread out a bit more. There were five of them and the boardwalk was just too small at the most two of them could fit next to each other there, but it was tight. Luckily the beach here was huge, a half mile before it hit the water.

Within seconds, the giants had caught the 'big' kids. They stood in front of them, barring movement in any direction with skates, skate-board, barefeet and whatever other obstacles they could make of themselves. This obstructed John's view of just what was going on. He heard the titans but that didn't tell half the story. He creeps by behind the giants and begins to climb a building, ignoring them as he seeks a better view.

By the time he gets there...
12331.title: Not so little kids...

123311.content:
After a bit of jumping and climbing, John reaches a perch atop a building, but is too late for the arguing and talking. What he does see however, is down on the beach all sorts of playing between the kids. The little ones ride over their now larger 'little' brothers and sisters for a skate park or launch off the abandoned and enormous roller-blades and skateboards, among other things. The two 'leaders' are really having fun, the big wolf throwing his 'bit' brother in the air and catching him, the brother doing stunts as he flew.

Dan was having the time of his life, he was spread out on the beach digging his feet in underground and propped up on a sand dune. In his hands he held Jack, his formerly big brother. He tossed the tiny wolf into the air, he'd do tricks and either be caught or land in the forest of fur on a soft and enormous stomach. This was just too cool.

Jack was in the air and coming down, he'd just done a series of flips and twists and now had to land. Dan's gigantic hands missed him. Pushing his feet down he fell into a forest of fur and pushed the huge belly down four feet, almost as far down as he was tall. He came out and walked across the enormous moving surface, the warmth on his pads feeling more like a spongy-heated stone than skin.

Elsewhere, Jim and Matt were sitting foot to foot, pad to pad and formed a huge obstacle course for Mike and Will, their 'big' brothers. Fur, dirt and whatever else they could come up with blocked the half-inch tall cat's way down the slopes. At the feet it took all they to shoot up and jump at the toes. Then again, that was also a few hundred foot long ramp.

The other boy pair in the group was out at sea. Rick, the giant fox floated like an ocean platform and had all sorts of fun. he was a diving board, a sea-monster and more. Best of all for him though, was that he was bigger than Nate, his brother, could dive down! When the bigger fox went down, he went to the bottom and could've made it farther. The little fox fought a sea-beast, got huge waves and more.

Last of the group were the girls. Kate the enormous white cat and Jane the little blonde feline. They both knew how to party like no tomorrow but were just as good at relaxing. Kate was stretched out soaking up the sun, despite her white fur doing its best to stave off the heat. Next to her on a mountain of skates, Jane was stretched out catching the light her sister reflected.

As they played, John crept in slow and silently. He was taking aim one at a time, changing everyone to see if they could be just as friendly under different conditions...
123311.title: Playing Together

1233111.content:
A ray shot out from everywhere, catching all of the titans at one point or another. They climbed upward while the 'big' kids stayed just where they were. The beach became crowded for the giants now, they had to spread out some as now the 'little' siblings were far larger than the beach, if they laid parallel to the peers, their backs were in the water with their now being a half mile of beach and two miles of kids.

For Jack when he came down from the last toss, the forest he landed in was bigger than any he'd ever seen. The fur went 300 feet overhead, he had to wonder how he'd be found as even fleas would dwarf him. He wandered aimlessly through the jungle of his brother. Dan didn't notice anything untilhe stopped feeling his brother on his gut or hin his hands...

The twins perhaps had it worst. The giants were pushed back with their growth and for a second moved. When the older brothers made the jump at the feet, both landed between a thousand feet of toes. The gigantic twins just stayed put, not knowing and thinking the little people were still at it.

At sea, Nate was nearly eaten by Rick. The smaller one got in the gigantic mouth and came close, but lived through it by sheer luck.He was spat out onto a palm pad and from there taken ashore. There wasn't any more to do at sea as the gigantic fox really was an island now and could easily kill the little one, not to mention he had to go so much farther out to not touch bottom now.

Lastly, the girls, really were not effected. Kate got her feet soaked and dripped a bit on Jane, but that was minor and they really weren't doing anything.

A new activity was needed...

1233112.content:
The ray lashed out at everyone, the kids became normal size and the teens were actually smaller than before. At first the 'big' brothers and sisters thought that's what they'd be again as they saw the others take up less and less of the sky, only to soon climb out of their own foot prints, now an eight of an inch tall to the world.

As John looked around, he realized he forgot two, the sea foxes. It didn't take long for them to come ashore. When they did, they saw right away the changes. Nate bent down to examine his tiny friends while all the others looked up at the enormous Rick behind him. The 'little' kids knew how their siblings felt about the size in a way and the big ones got soaked by a giant friend and saw the biggest thing of their lives.

In a flash, another bolt caught Nate and he joined the 'big' kids in looking up at Rick. The gigantic fox couldn't see them now, though so him, or at least his titanous toes towering which were 30 feet tall to normal people and to the little teens were around the 4 and 5 mile tall mark. It didn't make them feel any better to be swimming in Nate's footprint, specifically the toes thanks to all the water he dumped on them, washed down--hill.

A beam at last lances Rick and takes him back to normal and he too climbs out of his swimming pool of a pawprint. As one they come on their now tinier 'big' siblings and are all standing around the pawprint holding them. They could go on or find better stuff to do with them...

In the ground the older siblings looked up almost three thousand feet at the "little" kids. They now had siblings bigger than the world's tallest skyscrapers...

From his safe area, John watches and plots to follow and just keep experimenting, he has the power...

Right ahead, the twins were getting ready to head out. Matt's toes towered into the sky but they had to get up someone before they left. The teens threw on a burst of speed and ultimately their disreguard to the others is what made up John's mind. He took aim at the whole group and fired. They rapidly shriveled away to specks but didn't even notice, they were that bent on speed. The board's under them were 400 feet wide but all they thought about was going forward, faster, even if they were anything but.

Although most of the boardwalk didn't notice the tiny teens, Dan, the younger kid's effective leader, did. Approaching from the back the cat was a foot away from the 'big' kids when he slammed a paw down to bar escape to the back. His discarded skateboard rolled along to the side and stopped. Remarkably the little creatures had yet to notice what happened.

Next along was their fox, Rick. He skated to a stop and quickly took the skates off, they were Matt's and he now knew he hated skates. As he fought with the inline blades, not meant for fox feet, Jim and Kate skated up to the other side,not knowing what was going on, but filling in their loose circle.

On that one board, the 'big' siblings were still racing forward. A second later two enormous objects sail through the sky overhead and a black wall slams right in front of them. The whole group freezes and looks around, now realizing what happened. In front Rick's leg barred their path for a second or two before he realized things himself and moved it. Beyond that, Dan's toes reached 300 feet into the sky and to the back a cat blocked them as to the side two skates skeemed to go forever into the sky with the world's biggest wheels.

From a safe spot, John watched all of this, wondering just what would happen... He's in just the right position for the wrong thing to happen as someone nails him from behind...

In the end, the group concludes that the big wolf house was their best bet. With Dan in the lead, they set off across town as fast as they could go. To the tiny creatures coming with, it was like riding a jet or a rocket as hundreds and thousands of miles were crossed.

123332111.content:
There is a sudden shaking from all around and an enormous booming to follow it, the group looks up to see the blurry room door in the distance fly open to let all of Dan's 'little' brothers and sisters fly in, or at least a number of them. The giant fox tried to chase them off, but not before those below got a real sense of scale.

The 'little' kids toes were around a thousand feet tall, by their ankles they were bigger than any skyscraper. Overall the giants clear of 2 miles tall. When they came near Dan he was nearly crushed underfoot and a few times shot into the air just from the shaking of the wood after the giant footsteps. The mud and fur flying was just as much of a threat.

Several times, a 'little' lupine taill swept across the ground like a baseball bat, measured in scales of miles and hitting with a force like a giant machine. How the tiny kids avoided them is something no-one's gonna ever really know, same as how they'll never know how they survived getting that close to the 'little' kids enormous pads and not be a stain on them.

Back with John, things had not gone at all well since he lost the ray. He was on the fox for the longest time, between the toes for a while. At the house when Rick dumped the skates he got free, but his freedom left him next to the other part of the group, so that when they shrank, he went with. At 1/128th to the shrunken kids, he was around 0.000009766 of an inch tall to the world beyond by his best guess and more likely than not, far smaller.

With the only choice for survival with the shrunken wolf, John leapt up the enormous toes and began to climb, his goal was to reach the ray barrel for when they grew or in the least to stick with the giants. When the cubs showed up, he realized how small he was to the world...

His big hope being that they'd be small enough to either sink into a pore in the wood or fit in one of the many thousands of grooves in a pad.

In fractions of a second, the 'little' brothers and sisters became walking planets, or at least close to it. A single pad had to measure in the order of ten miles and bigger. Even the BIG brothers and sisters would be huge at this point, big enough to assuredly compare on the scale of miles. Then, the plan backfired.

The tiny creatures did survive, but they were stuck to the foot. When it came down, billions of gallons of sweat flooded off the pad which had been overhead. They floated in in, in total darkness for a few minutes and when the foot came up, they went with. Seconds later, the gigantic 'little' siblings were running out the door and down the hall with their 'big' brother Dan along for the ride.

Jim kept growing, looking around at the ever shrinking world. Trees that had towered over him dwindled, giving him a clear view into the park on his left. Houses quickly fell to the same condition. He even had to step off th sidewalk as his barefeet no longer fit on it, though by that point it didn't matter, the masive weight of a single paw had caved in the cement walkway under it. His boy towered 450 feet into the sky and 480 if the ears were counted into it. Behind him, a tail stretched 140 feet long and twitched in the air. The ray actually worked! This gun that had showed up from nowhere actually worked! For proof an eight year old stood taller than almost anything around the immediate area and at that had caved in large parts of pavement. What luck! Now however, the ray's other buttons and settings had to be tested just to ensure that there was full control. Shrink especially right now or whatever was grown would always be a threat unless the little lion grew too.

Still unnoticed and behind cover, John put the gun on shrink and took aim, hoping that he'd be able to take the eight year old down to size. Before the wolf moved, the trigger was pulled and a blue lance struck out from the bush, except this time the lupine could see where it came from with ease, this time it was a step or two away for him. This had to work or it may not end well.

The beam hit one of Jim's toes and went unnoticed for several minutes. It may never have gained attention except that the wolf began to shrink. At first it was slow, probably a few normal inches, but then it picked up on an exponential scale. He rapidly lost ground to the environment. Where the trees once struggled to poke over his toes they were reaching his knees and very soon afterward his chest and shoulders. At ten feet tall the titan stepped back on the sidewalk, and soon had gone from a 686400 pound giant to a 57.2 pound little wolf. The impressions from his footprints were deep enough that he had to climb in and was down up to his shoulders.

John kept up on the trigger however. The beam was now in the wolf's chest as it was at the growth shot. Bit by bit the lupine became a very little lupine compared to his former self with a towering height of 45 inches. Even with the small scope on the gun, the lion eventually could no longer see his mark. Jim had gone from being normal, as tall as the craters to being of large toddler type heights and then to wading in fields of short grass to using pebbles for housing and then it was nearly impossible to see him.

The food court was on the opposite side of the mall, but John figured it would be the most interesting place to start growing someone. He walked through the mall at a brisk pace, arriving at the food court in less than ten minutes. The dinner rush had started to die down, but most of the tables still had groups seated at them. "Hmm, picking someone to test this gun on would be a little difficult, but after a few minutes of staring, he had narrowed it down to three groups.

The first was a pair of young teenage boys who were sitting at a table towards the back corner. One was a meerkat, very slender with shaggy dark-brown hair and deep brown eyes, who couldn't have been more than fourteen years old. He wore a tight-fitting teal t-shirt with a large pink diagonal stripe and even tighter brown corduroy pants. Across from him was a lynx with greyish-blue fur, slightly taller and more built than the meerkat, perhaps a year or two older, wearing a wire-frame pair of glasses and a form-fitting black polo shirt with jeans. After observing the pair for a minute, seeing the way they looked into each other's eyes and gently brushed each other's hands, John came to the conclusion that they were probably boyfriends, or at least on a date.

The second group John saw was a group of four college-aged furs, two guys and two girls. John couldn't quite tell if they were on a double date or just hanging out as friends, but they all seemed to be having a good time. One of the guys was a tall, charismatic kangaroo with a wide smile and a loud laugh, while the other one was a shorter and slightly less outgoing rabbit, who seemed to let his bigger friend drive most of the conversation with the group. Across from them sat the two girls, one a vixen wearing a tube top and a rather revealing skirt, and the other a more sensibly-dressed ferretess. This group seemed to get along well with each other, and would comment on other furs as they passed by, cracking each other up with jokes and observations.

The final furs that John had his eye on was a pair of tiger cubs, both around 8 or 9 years old, who were running around chasing each other while their mother sat at a nearby table chatting with a friend. These two looked nearly identical to each other, and John guessed that they were twins. Watching them for several minutes, John was surprised by the level of energy they were able to keep up, and guessed that they must be a handful for their mother.

After thinking for a moment, John finally makes his decision, walking up to and aiming his gun at...
